snippet: Alber Elbaz reveals a prefall collection full of texture, shine and stunning proportions.
abstract: Alber Elbaz reveals a prefall collection full of texture, shine and stunning proportions.
lead_paragraph: "This collection is about fabric, technology and volume," Alber Elbaz said at the start of his prefall presentation earlier today. Citing innovations in fabric - first, with the incorporation of metals into knits and wovens, and now with things that have been bonded, plastified and waxed - as his muse, Elbaz went on to show a collection full of texture (felted wool and fox), shine (sequins and coated cotton so glossy it looks wet) and stunning proportions (fly-away jackets and exaggerated, egg-shaped shoulders). Here, a romantic all-emerald look that illustrates all three of Elbaz's points is anchored by a giant cameo pendant.
